main event: Several residents of West Palm Beach, Florida reported seeing a fiery object streak across the sky shortly after the launching of an Atlas missile from Cape Canaveral on January 27, 1959.
interesting points: A ball of fire was reported by several persons to have plunged into the Bay at Mobile, Alabama, but no explanation was given.
Two blasts, strong enough to rattle windows and glassware, were reported at Montgomery, Alabama, but this turned out to be the ordinary noise of jet planes breaking the sound barrier.
The Atlas missile launched from Cape Canaveral was visible from the launch site for approximately 5 minutes, which would be at a range of approximately 450 to 500 nautical miles.
Numerous reports were received of an object appearing to be a brilliantly illuminated cloud, which could be related to the Atlas missile launch.

An unidentified flying object was observed south of Kindley Air Force Base, Bermuda, described as a small red object with sparks fanning outward, approaching from the west and veering to the south-southeast, gaining altitude and appearing to be spiraling and leaving a luminous exhaust, in sight for approximately 12 minutes.
sighted object: A fiery object, a ball of fire, a brilliantly illuminated cloud, and an unidentified flying object with a red light and sparks
location: West Palm Beach, Florida; Mobile, Alabama; Montgomery, Alabama; Bermuda
witnesses: Several residents, aircraft crew, personnel at Kindley Air Force Base
